definitions.definition: an amount of money given to somebody by an organization to help pay for their education

examples.text: She **won a scholarship** to study at Stanford.
He went to drama school on a scholarship.
She was awarded a scholarship to Columbia University.
The Fund awards four scholarships every year.
Two of the boys are on football scholarships.

definitions.definition: the serious study of an academic subject and the knowledge and methods involved

examples.text: Oxford became one of the great centres of medieval scholarship.
Her two books maintain the highest standards of scholarship.
He wrote in the tradition of German scholarship.
